title: A/B Testing: Letting Users Decide Design Debates
description: One-minute skill: A/B Testing: Letting Users Decide Design Debates.

hook.text: Google tested 41 shades of blue for a link color. The winning shade earned an extra $200 million per year.

buildup.text: A/B testing shows half your users Version A and half Version B, then measures which performs better with real behavior.

discovery.text: It removes opinion from design decisions. Instead of 'I think this is better,' you have 'Data shows this converts 15%.

punchline.text: Don't argue about design. Test it. Let users vote with their behavior.
